evisceration noun [C or U]
(ORGAN REMOVAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of removing one or all of the organs from the inside of a body: The author is a woman who can make an earthworm evisceration fascinating. He will interview pathologists about their evisceration techniques.
More examplesFewer examplesTreatment of his advanced pancreatic cancer included a partial abdominal evisceration.The preparation of animal-based food usually involves slaughter, evisceration, hanging, portioning, and rendering.The birds are defeathered then pass to the evisceration room where their organs are blasted out with water.

evisceration noun [C or U]
(DESTRUCTION)
the destruction or weakening of an idea, principle, etc.: The country has seen a decades-long evisceration of civil society. The book is a well-researched and witty evisceration of conservatism. See
eviscerate
More examplesFewer examplesThere is concern that we are about to witness the evisceration of net neutrality. There will be verbal eviscerations of fashion on the runway.She didn’t hold back in her evisceration of self-absorbed brides.
